oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stagecrafters' picnic, between 1915 and 1925
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the Stagecrafters theater group. Formed in 1906, the Stagecrafters were the earliest of Nashville's local theater groups. Their membership was limited to 50 drama devotees. The purpose was to "develop talent among amateurs and to give public and private performances for charity and other causes." They continued to support local theater until the mid 1930s. This picnic took place at Montgomery Bell Academy in Nashville, Tenn. Pictured from left to right in the first row: Mrs. Wilson, Lip Davis, Bob Alexander, Dr. S. C. Mitchell, unidentified, J.B.and C. Bill Shearon, Dr. Neil Rutland; Second row: Catherine Winner, Mrs. Fred Coe, Ellen Wallace, Roberta Alexander, M.J. Jane Douglass, Mrs. Joe Hibbets, Lillian Shearon, unidentified, Mrs. Lip Davis, unidentified, Dr. A. M. Harris. Forms part of the Madge West Joseph Scrapbooks. 1 photograph : b & w; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilson, Mrs.; Davis, Lip; Alexander, Bob; Mitchell, S.C.; Shearon, J.B.; Shearon, C. Bill; Rutland, Neil; Winner, Catherine; Coe, Fred, Mrs.; Wallace, Ellen; Alexander, Roberta; Douglass, M.J. Jane; Hibbets, Joe, Mrs.; Shearon, Lillian; Davis, Lip, Mrs.; Harris, A.M.
